<A Hawaiian Wedding Song
1:
--------------------
<Text: Hawaiian Wedding Song:  It was adapted from a 1926 love song written by Charles E. King for his operetta, "The Prince of Hawaii".>
Triplets:<Charles E. King
2:
--------------------
Text: Hawaiian Wedding Song:  Originally titled "Ke Kali Nei Au" (Hawaiian for "Waiting Here for You"), Al Hoffman and Dick Manning translated the original Hawaiian words into English and renamed it "Hawaiian Wedding Song".
Triplets:<Al Hoffman
